parts.instructions: Write NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS AND/OR A NUMBER.

questions.prompt: Date of Birth: 12th March ________
House Number: ________
Customer’s Name: Jennifer ________
Home Telephone: 01934 ________
Monthly Bill Paid By: ________
Tom, the sales guy at R&N Mobile, said I would not get the extra ___ of internet that I wanted
but he was able to issue a new contract, as the _____ had not been activated yet.
I can still terminate the contract as long as I do it ___ days in advance.
Price of US$ ___ per month has not changed
If I want to get a new cell phone, I can order one on the website - Tom will send me the ___ to the online store by email.

parts.instructions: Choose FIVE letters A–O (11-15). Complete the table (16-20).

questions.prompt: Which of the following can be found in the Johnson Building?
Water Park Complex's notes: Reserved for holiday park ___ from 9 a.m. to 12 noon.
Mini-golf's notes: All equipment supplied; groups play at ___ intervals
Jogging's notes: Morning jog easier - flat + ___ km
Jogging's notes: Afternoon jog harder - hillier + 6km in length. Both runs begin with gentle ___ and finish with stretching.
Levington's notes: Costs £2; buy at reception or from ___;book early to avoid disappointment.

parts.instructions: Choose the correct letter A, B, or C (21-25). Complete the summary (26-30).

questions.prompt: What is the subject of Professor Norris’ seminar next week?
What is Alex’s course is about?
options: A How wild boar were re-introduced in the UK
B How animals breed in different environments
C How foreign species affect environments

questions.prompt: What was most responsible for reducing the numbers of UK wild boar until they totally disappeared in the thirteenth century?
options: C A royal order for their extermination

questions.prompt: What was the main problem with farming wild boar in the UK in the 1970s?
options: A It did not make much money

questions.prompt: Why is the number of boar now probably more than 800?
options: A More and more boar have escaped from farms
B The escaped and released boar have bred
C The Forestry Commission has released more boar to ensure healthy bloodlines

questions.prompt: The wild boars of the Forest of Dean are now officially wild animals and the local ___ is responsible for them.
Many locals say the high numbers of boars is not a problem. It’s reported that the ___ will move the young away when they meet humans.
The Forestry Commission now regularly kills boars to control numbers, but animal rights activists attempt to disrupt the ___ doing this.
The forest cannot be closed on cull days and activists patrol the ___ where they know the culls take place to protect the animals.
The rangers now try and kill the wild boars on ___ dates
New Zealand’s EEZ’s depth can be up to ___ metres
Fishing can damage sea life, especially with bottom trawl or dredge equipment. Factors include: type of seabed habitat; the ___ used
The unwanted species taken (called the ___) are thrown back in sea, often dead or dying.
Conservationists claim sea floor life takes a long time to recover, if at all. This is disputed by ___
Part of New Zealand’s fisheries management program is likened to
options: A similar initiatives in other countries.
C similar initiatives that were not implemented in the past.

questions.prompt: Most current BPA seabeds
options: A have never had trawlers operating there.
B have been carefully charted by the New Zealand Ministry of Fisheries.
C have been damaged by previous fishing.

questions.prompt: Charted hydrothermal vents
options: A are difficult to locate for protection purposes.
B are key targets for the fishing industry.
C are closed to all fishing.

questions.prompt:
For questions below use no more than three words and/or a number 
 It’s claimed that more than  ___ per cent of the New Zealand EEZ has never been subject to bottom trawling.
Conservation critics of the New Zealand government claim that not all vulnerable ___ are protected
The work of industrial trawlers also affects the  ___ of smaller communities, as the catches of their fishermen also suffer.
